jdbc.query

Class NotificationQueries

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdbc.query.NotificationQueries

  • public class NotificationQueries
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles database operations related to notifications for orders. It includes methods for checking and updating order statuses based on notification logic, such as automatic cancellation or marking orders as notified or irrelevant.
    Author:
    Tamer Amer, Gal Bitton, Rabea Lahham, Bahaldeen Swied, Ron Sisso, Nadav Reubens.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NotificationQueries

        public NotificationQueries()

    • Method Detail

      • CheckAllOrdersAndChangeToCancelledIfNeeded

        public java.util.ArrayList<Order> CheckAllOrdersAndChangeToCancelledIfNeeded(java.time.LocalDateTime localDateTime)
        Checks all orders with a 'Notified' status and updates them to 'Cancelled' if the current date and time surpass the order's enter date. This method is intended to automate the cancellation process for unconfirmed notified orders.
        Parameters:
        localDateTime - The current local date and time to compare order enter dates against.
        Returns:
        A list of orders that were automatically cancelled due to being past the enter date.

      • automaticallyCancelAllNotifiedOrders

        public void automaticallyCancelAllNotifiedOrders(Order order)
        Automatically updates the status of a specified order to 'Cancelled'. This method is typically used to cancel orders that have not been confirmed by the user within a specific timeframe after being notified.
        Parameters:
        order - The order to be cancelled.

      • automaticallyMarkOrdersAsIrrelevant

        public void automaticallyMarkOrdersAsIrrelevant(Order order)
        Marks a specified order as 'Irrelevant'. This status change is typically used for orders that no longer require action or attention, for instance, when an order is outdated or has been superseded by another order.
        Parameters:
        order - The order to be marked as irrelevant.

      • CheckAllOrdersAndChangeToNotifedfNeeded

        public java.util.ArrayList<Order> CheckAllOrdersAndChangeToNotifedfNeeded(java.time.LocalDateTime localDateTime)
        Checks orders with a 'Wait Notify' status to see if their enter date matches the current date and time, and updates their status to 'Notified' accordingly. This method facilitates the process of notifying users about their upcoming orders.
        Parameters:
        localDateTime - The current local date and time used to check against order enter dates.
        Returns:
        A list of orders that have been updated to 'Notified' status.

      • CheckAllWaitingListOrdersAndCancelAutomaticallyIfNotConfirmed

        public java.util.ArrayList<Order> CheckAllWaitingListOrdersAndCancelAutomaticallyIfNotConfirmed()
        Automatically cancels orders that have been in a 'Notified Waiting List' status for a specific period (e.g., 2 hours) without confirmation from the user. This method ensures that unconfirmed orders do not indefinitely occupy space in the waiting list.
        Returns:
        A list of orders that were automatically cancelled due to lack of confirmation.

      • UpdateAllWaitNotifyOrdersToNotify

        public void UpdateAllWaitNotifyOrdersToNotify(Order orderToUpdate)
        Updates the status of specified orders from 'Wait Notify' to 'Notified'. This is used to mark orders for which notifications should be sent out to the users, indicating that they need to take action (e.g., confirm or cancel the order).
        Parameters:
        orderToUpdate - The order whose status is to be updated.

      • CheckWaitingListAndRemoveAllIrrelcantOrders

        public java.util.ArrayList<Order> CheckWaitingListAndRemoveAllIrrelcantOrders(java.time.LocalDateTime localDateTime)
        Checks all orders in the waiting list and marks them as irrelevant if their enter date is earlier than the specified localDateTime. This cleanup operation ensures that the waiting list does not contain orders that are no longer valid.
        Parameters:
        localDateTime - The current local date and time used for comparison.
        Returns:
        A list of orders that were marked as irrelevant.

      • CheckNotifiedFromServer24Hours

        public boolean CheckNotifiedFromServer24Hours(int OrderId)
        Checks if a specific order with the given OrderId has been in a 'Notified' status for 24 hours. This method can be used to identify orders that may require further action such as cancellation or follow-up notification.
        Parameters:
        OrderId - The ID of the order to check.
        Returns:
        true if the order has been notified for 24 hours; false otherwise.
